name: Sitting Calf Raises
how_to_perform:
1. Sit on the edge of a chair, bench, or platform with your feet flat on the floor and your back straight.
2. Lift one foot off the ground by raising your heel as high as possible while keeping your knee straight.
3. Hold this contraction for a brief moment before slowly lowering your heel back to the starting position.
4. Repeat on the other side by lifting the second foot off the ground and repeating the movement, as if you were alternating calf raises.
5. Continue alternating legs with slow and controlled movements.
6. Increase the intensity of the exercise by adding weight or resistance in both hands for added support,
7. Perform multiple sets to achieve maximum desired results
short_summary: Sitting calf raises are an isolation-type strength training exercise that primarily targets the gastrocnemius muscle.
